Magnus effect. The curve is due to Newton's third law. For this effect, the ball should possess both translational and rotational kinetic energy.
When the ball rotates, due to viscosity or air friction the ball forces the air to fill the backward vacuum from the rotating side and this the air also applies an equal and opposite force on the ball and as the ball was moving straight, this incident the ball to followes the curved path.
